title: Practice Areas
subtitle: Being exposed to complex issues working in a variety of industry sectors, our business savvy lawyers have the relevant experience and expertise in the below practice areas. Please feel free to contact us at.

enquiry@arghyalegal.com for specific queries and detailed discussions. Although we focus on the below practice areas, we also assist our Clients to find the right resource at optimal costs without compromising on quality and outcome.

practices.title: All things Startup
subtitle: We provide handholding to startups in their early years by  setting up a legal ecosystem which includes:
text: Structuring the formation of a company.
Guiding on regulatory licences and compliances.
Guide on labour and employment related issues.
Assist on contracts for the business.
Guide on brand protection.
Assist in secretarial compliances.
Standardising internal policies.
Negotiating with customers and vendors on behalf of our Clients keeping in mind the best interest of our Clients.
Public relations strategy.
Assist in hiring the right resource for your specific needs.
practices.subtitle2: We act as external legal in-house counsels for startups and take care of their day to day legal needs at a very cost effective pricing.

practices.title: E-Commerce
subtitle: Our team has advised companies like Flipkart and Myntra on various regulations relating to the E-commerce sector. We advice mainly on:
text: Assist in interpretation of applicable laws.
Providing guidance on business strategy based on prevailing regulations.
Undertake gap analysis on existing business and provide solutions in line with existing laws.
Assist in structuring of new business in line with the law.
Assist in training business teams on compliance of laws applicable to e-commerce industries.

practices.title: Commercial Transactions
subtitle: We understand the importance of contracts to protect the rights and obligations of our Clients when they do business with third parties.  Our experienced lawyers provide the right guidance and relevant documents for every business need. We also partner with our Clients to assist in negotiating contracts with third parties to ensure risk coverage. Below are some of the areas we cover through our services which are based on specific customer requirements.
text: We guide business with the right document for a particular business transaction.

In collaboration with the in-house legal teams, we interact with internal stakeholders to understand business and provide standardised contract templates. This is mostly helpful if a Client has many group companies but different templates for similar business.
We analyse executed contracts to highlight risks and deviation from standard practises.
We assist in renegotiating terms of existing contracts on behalf of our Clients with third parties in order to protect their interest.
Will provide contract management for our Clients.
Connect technology to contract lifecycle and management.

practices.title: Regulatory Compliance
subtitle: Compliance with the law of the land is key to a company’s success. There are also various regulations which mandates companies have in place internal mechanisms to sensitise and train its employees on compliance of law. Over time we have seen during a violation, the absence of such mechanisms only aggravates issues for the company. Hence, we help companies to:
text: Do gap analysis to Identify risks.
Assist in drafting of standard operating procedures and documentation.
Assist in the setting up of various committees.
Adhere to proper procedures during investigations and subsequent consequences which may follow therefrom.
Procure licences.

practices.title: Training
subtitle: Our team has the vast experience of having trained and sensitised the entire workforce of multinational organisations on compliance of various regulations and assisted in implementation of global policies at a local level by having a glocal approach. Our training programs are mainly focussed on the following:
text: Our training programs are designed based on each company’s business in order to connect the audience to the subject matter by giving actual business examples which are relatable and more easier to understand rather than legal jargons which may not appeal to a non-legal audience.
Proactively collaborating with internal teams (mostly HR) to train new employees on the subject of Antitrust and Ethics and Compliance during their induction.
Train employees on various subjects of law viz. Antitrust and Ethics and Compliance.
Use a glocal approach in implementing global policies at a local level through training and sensitisation programs.
We focus mainly on Antitrust, preparedness for  Dawn Raids, POSH and Ethics and Compliance training.

practices.title: Contracts Management
subtitle: A common challenge faced by companies across verticals is having an insight to their contractual commitments. The sheer volume of data accumulated over a period of time makes it extremely overwhelming for individuals and teams to easily track and understand this information. To find a customer contract and look for relevant information would mean many man hours scanning through folders and unorganised contracts, leading to delays in decision making and perhaps having a critical impact on business. Our services will help:
text: Have access to organised contractual data in a format suitable to your needs. For inhouse legal teams it saves time by giving easy access to information required and free up time to spend on other critical work. Legal can use this information to empower other teams to make timely decisions by providing quick access to contract data requested.

Understand areas where there are deviations from regular standards and considerations made which are unfavourable for the company. Enforce company standards and renegotiate restrictive clauses wherever possible.

Help other teams stay on top of things which are critical for their business. Sales teams can access upcoming renewals to proactively push for renewals and look for opportunities to expand the relationship. Finance teams can easily track high value customer transactions to focus, enforce price escalations to generate more revenue growth.

practices.title: Dispute Resolution
subtitle: In our roles as in-house counsel in the past, we understand that litigation affects the bottom line of a company and the best way to resolve disputes of any kind is by way of mediation and negotiation as a first step. Our first approach during a possible litigious situation is always to facilitate mediation and guide both parties by becoming the mediator to help reach an amicable settlement.
Nonetheless, as a precautionary measure, we do collaborate with business though inhouse legal teams during such foreseeable litigation  scenarios to guide and assist the business:
text: The right way to correspond.
Collation of relevant documents.
Work on strategy and preparedness to handle actual litigation in future.
Finding the right effective resource for matters in courts.
Strategic advice for ongoing litigations.
Overall litigation management.
practices.subtitle2: Our lawyers have the experience and exposure nationally to  find the right resource at short notice as we understand the importance of time and quick action for favourable results during such situations.
